title: gTile@shuairan: Reset tile mode before resizing window
body:
Windows that are tiled or snapped by the Muffin window manager can't be
resized or moved. Reset the tile mode before resizing the window.

title: gTile@shuairan: Deal with complex panel configurations
body:
This commit enables gTile to deal with multiple panels at any screen
edge or monitor.

title: gTile@shuairan: Center grid in focused window
body:
The gTile grid popup is supposed to be centered on top of the currently
focused window. The according conditions are always false because of a
type mismatch: window.get_monitor() returns a number while a for/in loop
iterator is a string.

title: Win7AltTab@entelechy: Misc. clean up
body:
- Update deprecated Clutter API usage
- Improve formatting
- Replace for...in loops iterating arrays with normal for loops
- Clear the _checkDestroyedTimeoutId timeout
- Remove unnecessary uses of Lang.bind
- Use lexical scope for utility functions
- Fix invalid object access
- Use a more optimized method for overlaying window previews

Closes #10

title: DesktopCube@yare: Make compatible with Cinnamon 3.8+
body:
- Fix potentially fatal errors
- Add eslintrc, fix warnings
- Update deprecated Clutter API usage
- Use arrow functions where possible for older Spidermonkey engines
- Use for loops instead of forEach, its faster
- Fix inconsistent style
- Fix rendering for multi-monitor setups

Ref #102

title: gTile@shuairan: Fix location of readme and changelog
Update Watermark v3.8 (watermark@germanfr)

title: Update Watermark v3.8 (watermark@germanfr)
body: Changelog at: https://github.com/germanfr/watermark-cinnamon/commits/master

title: gTile@shuairan: Fix for Cinnamon 3.8+
body:
This is a general clean up. There's probably more that can be done, but the JS errors and Clutter warnings are fixed. CPU and memory usage seems stable with it enabled, so I'm adding version compatibility for 3.8 and 4.0.

- Fix usage of array constructor
- Initialize `grids` properly
- Remove unused variables
- Fix scoping issues
- Remove invalid syntax

Closes #174
Closes #166

title: gTile@shuairan : not working as of Cinnamon 3.8.9
body:
<!-- Extension's UUID should be in the title -->

```
 * Extension version/Build date 1524129089
 * Cinnamon version 3.8.9
 * Distribution - Ubuntu 18.04
 * Graphics hardware *and* driver used - RX 580, Mesa 18.2.1, Xorg 1.19
 * Snippet or attachment of ~/.cinnamon/glass.log
 * Snippet or attachment of ~/.xsession-errors:

> error t=2018-10-12T00:11:55Z 
> [gTile@shuairan]: redeclaration of let tracker
> [gTile@shuairan]: Error importing extension.js from gTile@shuairan

 ```

<!-- Author list: https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-extensions/blob/master/.github/CODEOWNERS -->

**Notify author of extension**
@shuairan

**Issue**
Extension does not actually load or function


**Steps to reproduce**
download extension, enable it and look at the looking glass log to see the failure message 


**Expected behaviour**
gTile works as it did in Cinnamon 3.6


**Other information**
I'm guessing this is simply bitrot as there's no current maintainer, I'm not savvy enough in JS or I would take a stab at this. Most likely just out of date JS code that's breaking since I think Cinnamon is using newer JS libraries.

title: Update maximus cinnamon-version
body: I updated to 3.6 and after trying it out for the day, it still seems to work. Note that I don't have much knowledge of the code at all, so no guarantees.

title: Cinnamon Tweaks (0dyseus@CinnamonTweaks)
body: Hoping this very useful extension will work in Mint 19.

title: cinnamon-maximus@fmete Use get_xwindow to obtain client id
body: The current way to get the id is a hack, what I believe an unnecessary rip-off of the equivalent extensions that use the mutter api. In mutter get_xwindow returns a gtk window and is not exposed to js. But in muffin it just returns the x11 client id and I believe it's exposed (and if not, that should be fixed, because there is no reason a simple integer couldn't be seen from js). So you can make your code shorter, prettier and cleaner. Combined with https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-extensions/issues/168 the complexity of your extension will be much reduced and you will gain on reliability at the same time.

title: cinnamon-maximus@fmete Use the now supported_GTK_HIDE_TITLEBAR_WHEN_MAXIMIZED
body:
Simplify the code (a lot!) and make the behavior more reliable using
https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/issues/7681. Basically you can follow the equivalent extension for Gnome (getting the client id is still a bit of a hack but otherwise you'll cleanup a lot of code).

title: let tracker redefined
body: extension works after not having a redundant line

title: Win7AltTab@entelechy: Fix for Cinnamon 3.8
body: Closes #163

title: Win7AltTab@entelechy freezes Cinnamon when pressing Alt+Tab
body:
<!-- Extension's UUID should be in the title -->

```
 * Extension version/Build date (to be found in "About.." or in "metadata.json"): can't find it in metadata.json
 * Cinnamon version (cinnamon --version): 3.8.3 (issues does not appear in 3.8.2)
 * Distribution - (Mint 17.2, Arch, Fedora 25, etc...): Arch
 * Graphics hardware *and* driver used: Intel
 * Snippet or attachment of ~/.cinnamon/glass.log: Nothing interesting
 * Snippet or attachment of ~/.xsession-errors: Nothing interesting

 ```

<!-- Author list: https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-extensions/blob/master/.github/CODEOWNERS -->



**Issue**
Cinnamon freezes partly. I can use the mouse to switch windows and start programs (both using the panel) but I can't send input to windows (neither keyboard nor mouse inputs). 


**Steps to reproduce**
1. Press alt+tab


**Expected behaviour**
It's known not to work but at least it should not break anything...
